author: Maria Armental
title: Maryland Company to Pay $2 Million to Resolve Bribery Charges - WSJ
text:
A Maryland company that had been accused of bribing a Russian nuclear-energy official in exchange for uranium-shipping contracts agreed to pay $2 million, far less than the $21.4 million recommended under federal guidelines, to resolve criminal charges.
The case, filed in Maryland federal court, was unsealed Tuesday.
Under a three-year deferred-prosecution...
